title: K12 Educator Competency Development for Digital Learning Environment Transformation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic educational technology and general experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Practice-Centered Curriculum Emphasizing Design Thinking and New Technology Utilization Capabilities, Based on a Collaboration Model Between University Innovation Hubs and K-12 Schools

learning_goals: Design educational content utilizing at least three digital learning tools applicable to K12 environments.
Develop one learner-centered instructional scenario by applying the design thinking process.
Evaluate and propose at least two instructional strategies suitable for blended (online-offline) learning environments.

Learners will select three core elements from the national educational technology standards (K-12 digital literacy) and online teacher qualification criteria (KOREATEACH 3.0), writing a 5-page comparative analysis report on their interconnections. The report must adhere to APA 7th edition formatting and achieve over 80 points on the instructorâ€™s rubric (content relevance: 40%, analytical depth: 30%, logical coherence: 30%).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
